H0.text: Mountains are most likely formed when glaciers melt.

H1.text: Mountains are most likely formed from earthquakes.

H2.text: When land sinks, mountains are most likely formed.

H3.text: Along tectonic plates, mountains are most likely formed.

A4.text: Mountain formation occurs due to a variety of geological processes associated with large-scale movements of Earth's crust (tectonic plates).

A5.text: When plates collide or undergo subduction (that is, ride one over another), the plates tend to buckle and fold, forming mountains.
